name: Liverpool
fun_fact: Fun fact: The word 'Scouse' (Liverpool's dialect AND its signature stew) comes from 'Lobscouse' - a sailor's stew brought by Scandinavian sailors. Liverpudlians became so associated with the dish that they're literally nicknamed 'Scousers'!

hero_dishes.name: Scouse
hero_dishes.description: A hearty lamb or beef stew with potatoes, carrots, and onions, served with beetroot and crusty bread
hero_dishes.origin_story: Brought by Norwegian and Baltic sailors, the name comes from 'lobscouse'. So central to Liverpool identity that locals are called 'Scousers'
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Maggie May's CafÃ©, The Baltic Fleet pub, traditional Liverpool cafÃ©s

hero_dishes.name: Wet Nelly
hero_dishes.description: A baked bread pudding made with leftover bread, dried fruit, and spices
hero_dishes.origin_story: A poor person's dessert from Victorian times, using stale bread. The 'wet' refers to the soaked bread texture
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Traditional bakeries, the Tate Liverpool cafÃ©, heritage restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Liverpool Tart
hero_dishes.description: Open tart with lemon curd and a lattice pastry top
hero_dishes.origin_story: A local variation on Bakewell tart, popular in Liverpool bakeries for generations
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Sayers bakery, Greggs (local versions), traditional cafÃ©s

hero_dishes.name: Chippy Tea
hero_dishes.description: Fish and chips from the local chippy - Liverpool has legendary fish and chip shops
hero_dishes.origin_story: Liverpool's port heritage means excellent fresh fish. The 'chippy tea' is a working-class Friday tradition
hero_dishes.where_to_find: The Lobster Pot, Maggie Fu's, traditional chippies across the city

signature_drinks.name: Purple (Vimto)
signature_drinks.description: Liverpudlians love Vimto - the purple fruit cordial is practically the city drink
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: With soda, in cocktails, or frozen as a slushy - purple is Liverpool

signature_drinks.name: Local Ales
signature_drinks.description: Liverpool has a thriving craft beer scene plus historic pubs serving real ale
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At historic pubs like The Philharmonic Dining Rooms or Black Lodge Brewery

food_culture_notes: The word 'Scouser' comes from the stew - you are what you eat!
Baltic Triangle is the hip food and drink neighborhood
Bold Street is incredibly diverse - every cuisine imaginable
Liverpool ONE brought modern dining options to the waterfront
